In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code that solves your problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    # Create a new column ym by extracting year and month from dt 
    df[:ym] = Int64[]
    for i in eachrow(df)
        push!(df[i,:ym],Dates.year(df[i,:dt])*100 + Dates.month(df[i,:dt]))
    end
    return df
end
```
This function goes through each row of the DataFrame and creates a new column `ym` by multiplying the year with 100 and adding the month to it. Then it pushes this value into the new column for that particular row.
